full_summary:
### Tender Opportunity
### Description 

The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) seeks to procure the services of professionals with expertise in data analysis, Tableau data visualization, and writing to support its Consumer, Research and Communications (CRC) Sector.

#### About the Project

The CRC requires support in processing and validating financial and geospatial data, developing and designing Tableau dashboards, evaluating accessibility, analyzing, summarizing, and describing industry data for public and internal consumption. The expected outputs will vary and depend on the services rendered during the fiscal year.

#### Rationale

This project is driven by the need to modernize the data collection, validation, and production process within the CRTC. The commission's data teams are currently understaffed and lack the expertise to achieve this goal. The output of this process feeds into the development of the Market Intelligence function.

#### Requirements

The CRTC requires:

* Five senior-level positions: three statistical analysts (two data scientists and a Tableau developer), a subject matter expert (economist), and a technical writer (Tableau designer)
* Two intermediate-level positions: two statistical analysts (a geo analyst and a project manager)
* One junior-level position: project manager

### Service Delivery

All work will be completed in Canada and offsite, using CRTC computers.

### Budget Information 

There is no reference budget provided for this contract. The current contract holder, Bronson Analytics, holds contract number 23-0121 with a value of $39,273.15 CAD.
